result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher C Meidl was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: The Court sentences the Defendant to pay court costs totalling $443(apply bond) to be paid by 5/25/16. Non-payment shall result in a 7 day jail term, with Huber privileges consecutive.

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Order for payment of Atty.David Zarwell as appointed defense counsel in the amount of $281.80.

It is hereby ordered that: The Defendant is liable for court appointed attorney fees.  The Defendant shall pay said attorney fees within 60 days.  Failure to pay attorney fees shall result in a jail sentence of 6 days c/s and entry of civil judgment.
with attachments and proposed order for payment of court appointed defense counsel fees from Attorney David Zarwell in the amount of $281.80.
Reminder Notice
with criminal case settlement and elements

Case called at 8:50am [mo]
Defendant Christopher C Meidl in court with Attorney David Zarwell.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights given; plea of " No Contest " entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel 

The Court sentences the Defendant to pay court costs totalling $443(apply bond) to be paid by 5/25/16. Non-payment shall result in a 7 day jail term, with Huber privileges consecutive.
recess: 8:58am
Court's review of Memo from bookkeeping re: missed atty fee payments: Court will address at next hearing
to Judge from Bkpg - Regarding: Failure to Comply with Court Order concerning payment of AFT payments.

Case called at 1:19 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Christopher C Meidl appears in custody, via video, from the Jefferson County Jail, with Attorney David Zarwell. Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court finds the proceedings are sight and sound sufficient

Bond arguments by Counsel

Court requires a $100 CASH bond, with no special conditions:

Case called at 2:22pm [mo]
Attorney David Zarwell in court.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty. Zarwell indicates he has no contact with Mr. Meidl, cannot give explanation for non-appearance.

The Court issues a Capias.
recess: 2:23pm
Status conference at 12-11-2015 02:00 pm

Case called at 3:14 pm [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for BrIV]
Attorney David Zarwell in court. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Zarwell: No explanation for non-appearance
ADA Hall: Requests warrant and forfeiture of warrant
Court orders issuance of bench warrant and orders bond to be forfeited
Atty Zarwell requests STAY of warrant, arguments presented
Court reviews prior court record and hearings - indicates that Mr. Meidl has made all prior appearances, was one prior issue
when Mr. Meidl did not return to court after filling out paperwork, but did appear at subsequent hearing
Court grants STAY of warrant until next weeks hearing
Recess: 3:18 pm

NEXT: Reschedule STC 12/11/15 at 2:00 pm - Send notices

Case called at 3:38pm [mo]
Defendant Christopher C Meidl in court.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court reviews Petition for Court Appointed Counsel with Mr. Meidl
The Court orders Mr. Meidl to pay $75 per month toward Court Appointed Attorney fees, payment is to begin on 11/1/15 and on the 1st of every month there after, until otherwise directed by the Court. The Court does NOT order an alternate.
The Court appoints Attorney David Zarwell to Mr. Meidl's case.
recess:3:44pm

NEXT: (1)PTC on 11/11/15 at 10:40am (2)STC on 12/4/15 at 2:30pm
State Public Defender Determination of Financial Eligibility - Defendant not eligible.
Adjourned initial appearance at 10-23-2015 03:15 pm

Case called at 9:41 am [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Robert Mawdsley presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Christopher C Meidl in court. ADA Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Mr. Meidl informs the Court that he does not qualify for SPD Services, he has contact Counsel, they were unavailable, requests Court appointed Counsel
Court again explains process for Court appointed Counsel - directs Mr. Meidl to COC Office to complete petition and bring back to Courtroom
Recess: 9:43 am Reconvene: 2:46pm
[Clerk MO]
Defendant, Christopher Meidl does NOT appear in court. DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin

The Court indicates that it had intended to have Mr. Meidl come back to court after retrieving the Petition for Court Appointed Counsel from the COC office. 
The Court directs the Court's JA to re-schedule this hearing(specifically next Friday when this Court is in Branch IV)
recess: 2:48pm

Reserve Judge Mawdsley presiding in Branch IV: 
[MK] case called at 2:36pm. 
Defendant Christopher C Meidl in court.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Service of Complaint admitted.  The Complaint is read, including the charge and maximum penalties.
Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given
After Mr. Meidl indicates that he desires counsel, the Court adjourns the Initial Appearance.
The Court requires $500 signature bond, with no special conditions.
